result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J Schramer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge remitted.  $243 to be paid as a condition of Probation/Extended supervision in 15CF1947.  Court financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of 25% of the prison wages and work release funds.  Restitution shall be paid pursuant to separate court order.

W/huber, concur to 15cf2227.
8-2-16: Stip and order Def is entitled to 15 days of jail credit.

Defendant in court with Attorney Bridget Laurent.  Robert J Jambois appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case to follow 15CF1947.
Referral to Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM)
Status conference at 10-12-2015 01:00 pm

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.  
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500.00  (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Trial Judge - Br 12

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Stephanie R Hilton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
